OOC: the demo charge that Fireblade blew up wasn't designed to explode 
as a fireball, it was an anti-matter explosion, designed to destroy or 
rip apart the bonds of molecules and such eating up the matter and 
leaving the molecules un attached. (ie. no fire, no light, just a dark 
energy sucking globe of destruction) Just clarifying. =) (Don't bother 
reposting.)

OOC2: Yan, the reason that I didn't respond with Menasor yet, is that 
I was waiting for Jen to respond... which is taking a long time (her 
hotmail wasn't letting her log in or something?)



--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Megan Solmonson" <tmrattrap@h...> wrote:
> 
> * Iron Raptor smiled mentally to herself once the acid struck FireBlade, but 
> a sudden movement caught her attention. Her head snapped towards the motion, 
> just seeing the back end of Switchblade but it was too late then.
> Though a sudden sharp pain caught IR in the side as the blade of the sword 
> sank in deep to her side, acidic mech-fluid spurting out from either side of 
> the blade and right towards FireBlade.
> Pain exploded in her mind as bright lights before she brought herself to 
> reach and grab the sword, reefing it out of her side and throwing it away ( 
> that is, if FB isn't hanging onto the handle, then she just pulled it out. 
> :)
> Iron Raptor hissed and bared her teeth down on FireBlade, rearing up on her 
> hind legs and slamming her hands down at him, trying to pin him to the 
> ground.
> Though before he could stick the bomb into her tail, the end of it opened up 
> to create two blades, like scissors, and positioned itself above his head.
> Though that wasn't the end of the bomb.
> Since it must have been set to blow quickly, it exploded and a ball of fire 
> rushed up, creating a blinding cloud of smoak.
> And just then, the end of the tail whipped down, ready to snap shut on 
> contact.*
> 
>
